docs.title: Welcome to the AI Learning Hub
docs.description: Choose your path by audience and experience level, then dive into quickstarts, concepts, evaluations, and patterns.

docs.title: Data Platform Benchmarks
docs.description: Measure end‑to‑end latency and cost when AI calls touch Fabric, Snowflake, Databricks, or Qlik Cloud.

docs.title: Grounded QA Evaluations
docs.description: Measure faithfulness and citation accuracy for RAG answers.

docs.title: Latency–Cost Tradeoffs
docs.description: Balance perceived speed with spend: model selection, streaming, caching, and truncation.

docs.title: Offline Batch Evaluations
docs.description: Run nightly evals with diff reports; store metrics to detect regressions.

docs.title: Evaluations: Overview
docs.description: Define goals, golden sets, and a taxonomy for measuring correctness, helpfulness, safety, latency, and cost.

docs.title: Rubric Prompts
docs.description: Design rubrics for correctness, helpfulness, tone, and safety; improve inter‑rater agreement.

docs.title: Tool Use Evaluations
docs.description: Measure success rate per tool, categorize timeouts/errors, and find flaky behaviors.

docs.title: Agents vs. classic automation
docs.description: Decide when to reach for multi-step AI agents and when deterministic automation is faster, cheaper, and safer.

docs.title: Placing GenAI among ML, expert systems, and RPA
docs.description: Compare classical automation approaches so you can select the right blend of rules, models, and agents for each business problem.

docs.title: Responsible AI essentials
docs.description: Practical guardrails for bias, transparency, and human oversight in applied AI teams.

docs.title: Generative AI vs. Agentic Systems
docs.description: Compare single-shot prompting with multi-step, tool-using agents so you can decide which approach fits your problem.

docs.title: AI glossary
docs.description: Concise definitions for common AI terms used throughout the hub.

docs.title: Prompting styles and when to use them
docs.description: Instruction, few-shot, chain-of-thought, critique-and-repair, and planning prompts with tradeoffs and runnable examples.

docs.title: Safety basics for AI projects
docs.description: Identify common risks (jailbreaks, leakage, toxicity) and apply a lightweight checklist to new AI prototypes.

docs.title: Spec-first vs. vibe-based coding with LLMs
docs.description: Learn how lightweight specs, evals, and guardrails keep AI-assisted development on track compared with improvisational prompting.

docs.title: Structured outputs in practice
docs.description: Design JSON schemas, validate responses, and choose providers that support constrained generation.

docs.title: Tokens, context windows, and latency
docs.description: Understand how tokens, context windows, and streaming influence cost and response times.

docs.title: What is Generative AI?
docs.description: Understand what generative AI can do, its limits, and how to decide when it is the right tool for the job.

docs.title: Example: A2A Coordination
docs.description: Show two agents collaborating (planner → executor or QA → fixer) with a short transcript and outcomes.

docs.title: Example: AI Customer Support Triage
docs.description: Router agent triages incoming messages with escalation rules and summaries.

docs.title: Example: Content drafter
docs.description: Build a writing assistant with tone controls, iteration loops, and a review rubric.

docs.title: Example: Data quality QA assistant
docs.description: Run read-only checks against databases and APIs, score issues, and surface false positives.

docs.title: Example: Meeting summarizer
docs.description: Generate structured minutes, decisions, and action items with traceable context.

docs.title: Provider switching with a thin abstraction
docs.description: Swap AI providers behind a small interface and avoid vendor lock-in.

docs.title: Agent‑to‑Agent (A2A) Collaboration
docs.description: Patterns for agents to hand off tasks, negotiate, and escalate to humans.

docs.title: Cost Controls for AI Apps
docs.description: Apply max tokens, streaming, truncation, caching hints, and retries to manage spend.

docs.title: Observability for AI Context
docs.description: Log the right metadata (not raw prompts) with correlation IDs and PII avoidance.

docs.title: Compare Providers: Request Shapes and Tradeoffs
docs.description: A neutral comparison of common request/response patterns, limits, and typical costs.

docs.title: Security Best Practices for AI Providers
docs.description: Handle keys, proxies, rotation, and logging safely across environments.

docs.title: Getting started: Your first AI idea
docs.description: A 10-minute guided worksheet to turn an idea into a concrete project brief with success metrics and next steps.

docs.title: JS/TS Server Route: Safe Provider Calls
docs.description: Implement a server-only route that calls OpenAI (or any LLM API) with retries, streaming, and guardrails.

docs.title: Python FastAPI Endpoint for AI
docs.description: Ship a minimal-yet-safe FastAPI endpoint that calls OpenAI, returns structured JSON, and includes retries, timeouts, and monitoring hooks.

docs.title: Try GenAI in 10 minutes
docs.description: Spin up a safe server-side endpoint in Node or Python that calls OpenAI and returns a structured response.

docs.title: Human-in-the-Loop
docs.description: Introduce approval gates for sensitive actions and define reviewer workflows.

docs.title: Output Filters
docs.description: Add classifier/rule-based filters to block or redact unsafe outputs before they reach users.

docs.title: Safety & Responsible AI: Overview
docs.description: Define what we block, what we log, when we escalate, and how we mitigate abuse cases.

docs.title: Prompt Safety
docs.description: Write prompts that minimize risk: scope clearly, avoid data leakage, and instruct models to refuse unsafe tasks.

docs.title: Tutorial: Agentic Helpdesk
docs.description: Build a helpdesk agent with tools (ticketing, search), plus a quick eval loop to verify outputs.

docs.title: Tutorial: Cost Guardrails
docs.description: Implement budgets and alerts across routes; add token caps, streaming, and summaries.

docs.title: Tutorial: MCP in VS Code
docs.description: Use Model Context Protocol servers in VS Code to connect tools securely; common setup and pitfalls.

docs.title: Tutorial: Observability End-to-End
docs.description: Add logs, traces, and dashboards for AI routes with sampling and PII safeguards.

docs.title: Tutorial: Prisma + Postgres for Sessions
docs.description: Model session storage with Prisma, run migrations, and support rollbacks.

docs.title: Tutorial: Production Hardening
docs.description: Implement retries, rate limits, backpressure, and circuit breakers for resilient AI services.

docs.title: Tutorial: RAG Starter
docs.description: Create a minimal RAG system with dataset curation, chunking, retrieval, and an evaluation loop.

docs.title: Pattern: Planner–Executor
docs.description: A classic agent loop where a planner decides next steps and an executor performs them with tools.

docs.title: Reflection Loop: Self‑Healing Outputs
docs.description: Use rubric prompts to critique model outputs, retry within a budget, and converge on quality.

docs.title: Router Agent: Multi‑Tool Selection
docs.description: Design a router that selects among tools based on user intent, with guardrails and timeouts.

docs.title: RAG Basics
docs.description: Minimal retrieval-augmented generation: chunking, indexing, and grounded citations.

docs.title: FAQ RAG Pattern
docs.description: Build a FAQ-style RAG with a simple eval hook to keep answers grounded.

docs.title: Hybrid ranking for RAG
docs.description: Combine sparse and dense retrieval with reranking for better relevance.

docs.title: Prompt spec template
docs.description: A lightweight prompt specification inspired by spec-kit.

docs.title: Cross‑Provider Tool/Function Calling
docs.description: Design schemas, ensure idempotency, and propagate errors consistently across providers.

docs.title: Batch Processing Workflows
docs.description: Run offline batches with retries, cost caps, and resumability.

docs.title: Anthropic: Overview and Setup
docs.description: Configure Anthropic, auth headers, model notes, basic tool use, and common errors.

docs.title: Migrate from OpenAI to Azure OpenAI
docs.description: Map base URL, api-version, and deployment names; avoid common pitfalls.

docs.title: Azure OpenAI: Setup and First Call
docs.description: Create an Azure OpenAI resource and deployment, then call it from Node and Python.

docs.title: Google Gemini overview
docs.description: A quick start with Gemini models, multimodal examples, and function calling.

docs.title: OpenAI: Auth, Models, and Limits
docs.description: Authenticate safely, map environment variables, and choose a sensible model for your use case.

docs.title: ChatGPT for Productivity: Safe and Effective Use
docs.description: Practical prompts, usage patterns, and safety tips to get reliable value from ChatGPT.

docs.title: Provider: OpenAI
docs.description: How to configure OpenAI as a provider in the app's server-side abstraction layer.

docs.title: ChatGPT Business overview for teams
docs.description: Workspaces, sharing, privacy, and using ChatGPT effectively at work.
